title: FIFA in advanced talks to suspend Russia until further notice
shortDescription: FIFA is in advanced talks over the suspension of the Russia national team until further notice.

title: Subscribe to the Sky Sports EFL Podcast
shortDescription: Listen to the latest episode and subscribe to the Sky Sports EFL Podcast from Sky Sports Football.

title: Chalobah reveals injury | Hasselbaink: It was a red card
shortDescription: Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink believes Naby Keita should have been sent off during the Carabao Cup final for his "dangerous" challenge on Trevoh Chalobah.

title: 'Incandescent' Everton complain to PL over referee decisions
shortDescription: Everton have made an official complaint to the Premier League and demanded an apology over recent refereeing decisions made against them.

title: Everton fan admits to assault for throwing bottle at Cash
shortDescription: An Everton fan has admitted assaulting Aston Villa footballer Matty Cash with a plastic bottle thrown from his seat.

title: FA urges FIFA, UEFA to ban Russia from World Cup & Women's Euros
shortDescription: The English FA has held private conversations with UEFA and FIFA, urging them to ban Russia from the upcoming men’s World Cup and Women’s Euros.

title: Spartak Moscow to be removed from Europa League by UEFA
shortDescription: UEFA is planning to remove Spartak Moscow from this season's Europa League in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Merson Says: Chelsea would have won if Mendy stayed on
shortDescription: Paul Merson says Chelsea would have won the Carabao Cup if Edouard Mendy had not been replaced by Kepa Arrizabalaga for the penalty shootout.

title: Carra: Would Liverpool have signed 'real deal' Diaz without Spurs interest?
shortDescription: Jamie Carragher says Luis Diaz was Liverpool's "best player" in the Carabao Cup final but questioned whether they would have signed him without Tottenham's interest.

title: Abramovich 'trying to broker peace' between Russia & Ukraine
shortDescription: Roman Abramovich is attempting to broker peace between Russia and Ukraine, the Chelsea owner's spokesperson has said.

title: Bloomfield: 'Every now and then there's a simple word I won't remember'
shortDescription: Matt Bloomfield was forced to retire after an accidental concussion during a Carabao Cup game last year. He tells Sky Sports his story.

title: Neville on Bielsa sacking: 'It went from exciting to just bad'
shortDescription: Gary Neville says Marcelo Bielsa's football went from exciting to "just bad", showing no respect for the opposition while Graeme Souness called the sacking "inevitable".

title: Scottish Premiership: Title race, top-six battle & who goes down?
shortDescription: Will Celtic or Rangers win the title? Who could finish in the top six? How will the relegation battle go? All you need to know from across the Scottish Premiership.

title: Ref Watch: 'It's handball by Rodri - VAR got seduced by angle'
shortDescription: Dermot Gallagher dissects the big flashpoints from the weekend's action, including the Rodri handball incident at Goodison Park.

title: Corsie: A better generation now for players to come out
shortDescription: Rachel Corsie and Claire Emslie speak about identity, and say there has never been a better time to come out.

title: Papers: Barca and Bayern compete for Christensen contract
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Monday's national and international newspapers...

title: Europe: Abraham scores 99th-minute winner for Jose's Roma
shortDescription: Tammy Abraham's penalty more than nine minutes into stoppage time ended Roma’s winless run as Jose Mourinho's scraped a 1-0 victory at 10-man Spezia in Serie A.

title: Redknapp on Kepa sub: A rubbish idea | Carra: There's method
shortDescription: Jamie Redknapp criticised the "ridiculous" call to bring Kepa Arrizabalaga on for Chelsea's Carabao Cup final shootout defeat - in which he missed the deciding spot-kick.

title: Chelsea 0-0 Liverpool (Pens 10-11)
shortDescription: Highlights of the Carabao Cup final between Chelsea and Liverpool from Wembley stadium.

title: Sub Kepa skies pen as Liverpool win epic shootout!
shortDescription: Substitute Kepa Arrizabalaga was brought on for the penalties but after failing to save any of Liverpool's 11 kicks, he skied his own to hand Jurgen Klopp's side victory.
